title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: interpreted heaven unto itself.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: to see stars again appearing one by one.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the prowling things that haunt the gloom of the forest.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rushes by a neighbouring lake and shot arrows at water-fowl. One stag was
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: killed, and some geese, and several teal.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: not; by day they hunted, and lit fires by night, and sang and feasted, and
title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them, venison was plentiful, and all manner of water-fowl: they loved the
title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: hand swept over the strings of his harp, awaking the deeper chords, like
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: "When there is blood in the bath she knows there is war in the mountains

author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and longs for the battle-shout of kingly men."
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: was gone as a dream is gone from a dreamer waked with a shout. And soon
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the great march began that faltered no more nor wavered. Unchecked by
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: battles, undaunted in lonesome spaces, ever unwearied by the vulturous
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: years, the warriors of Camorak held on; and Arleon's inspiration led them
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still. They cleft with the music of Arleon's harp the gloom of ancient
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: out singing, but with fewer voices; they came to villages in valleys full
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: others.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: They became a proverb for wandering, and a legend arose of strange,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: disconsolate men. Folks spoke of them at nightfall when the fire was warm
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and rain slipped down the eaves; and when the wind was high small children
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: feared the Men Who Would Not Rest were going clattering past. Strange
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: tops of the hills and never asking shelter; and mothers told their boys
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: who grew impatient of home that the grey wanderers were once so impatient
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and were now hopeless of rest, and were driven along with the rain
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: whenever the wind was angry.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But the wanderers were cheered in their wandering by the hope of coming to
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Carcassonne, and later on by anger against Fate, and at last they marched
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: on still because it seemed better to march on than to think.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: For many years they had wandered and had fought with many tribes; often
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: they gathered legends in villages and listened to idle singers singing
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: songs; and all the rumours of Carcassonne still came from the South.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And then one day they came to a hilly land with a legend in it that only
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: three valleys away a man might see, on clear days, Carcassonne. Tired
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: though they were and few, and worn with the years which had all brought
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: them wars, they pushed on instantly, led still by Arleon's inspiration
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: which dwindled in his age, though he made music with his old harp still.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: All day they climbed down into the first valley and for two days ascended,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and came to the Town That May Not Be Taken In War below the top of the
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain, and its gates were shut against them, and there was no way
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: round. To left and right steep precipices stood for as far as eye could
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: see or legend tell of, and the pass lay through the city. Therefore
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Camorak drew up his remaining warriors in line of battle to wage their
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: last war, and they stepped forward over the crisp bones of old, unburied
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: armies.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: No sentinel defied them in the gate, no arrow flew from any tower of war.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: One citizen climbed alone to the mountain's top, and the rest hid
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: themselves in sheltered places.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Now, in the top of the mountain was a deep, bowl-like cavern in the rock,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: in which fires bubbled softly. But if any cast a boulder into the fires,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: as it was the custom for one of those citizens to do when enemies
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: approached them, the mountain hurled up intermittent rocks for three days,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: and the rocks fell flaming all over the town and all round about it. And
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: mountain, and a great rock fell beyond them and rolled into the valley.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: The next two fell in front of them on the iron roofs of the town. Just as
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: shattered two of them. The mountain smoked and panted; with every pant a
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: rock plunged into the streets or bounced along the heavy iron roof, and
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: the smoke went slowly up, and up, and up.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: When they had come through the long town's empty streets to the locked
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: But when the morning came they remembered their war with Fate, and their
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: old resolve to come to Carcassonne, and the voice of Arleon rose in a
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Their beards were white, and they had travelled very far and hard; it was
title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Arleon said: "My King, I know no longer the way to Carcassonne."
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And Camorak smiled, as the aged smile, with little cause for mirth, and
title: A Dreamer's Tales

title: A Dreamer's Tales

author: Dunsany, Lord

title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: conquered us, and that our quest has failed."
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: And after this they were silent.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: Then they drew their swords, and side by side went down into the forest,
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: still seeking Carcassonne.
title: A Dreamer's Tales
author: Dunsany, Lord

text: I think they got not far; for there were deadly marshes in that forest,
title: A Dreamer's Tales

text: and gloom that outlasted the nights, and fearful beasts accustomed to its
